cheatsheet.title: Creating a C/C++ Managed Make project

intro.description: This guide will walk you though the process of creating a simple Managed "Hello World" application using the CDT.

item.title: C/C++ workbench setup
item.description: Start by setting up the CDT development environment.

item.title: Creating a C/C++ project
item.description: Choose one type of C/C++ project from the list. Then type a project name and type of project.

item.title: Creating files in the project
item.description: For a project to work it needs files. In this step you add one or more files to your project.

subitem.label: Click File > New > File to create a new source file.
Type a name for the new file. For example main.c for a C project.
Type some code into the main.c file. For example: #include <stdio.h> int main(int argc, char **argv) { printf ("Hello\n"); return (0); }
Click File > Save to save your new file.

item.title: Building projects and inspecting files
item.description: In this step you build the program to create a binary and examine it in a couple of C/C++ perspective views.

subitem.label: Click Project > Build All to create a binary of your source file.

item.title: Running the program
item.description: The final step is to create a run configuration that defines how the program is launched. Note you can define multiple run configurations if desired, each with its own settings.

subitem.label: Click Run > Run.. to run the program.
Create a run configuration by double-clicking the C/C++ Local Application item.
In the Main tab, click Search Program to select the binary to run.
In the Program Selection dialog box, select the binary to run with this run configuration, then click OK.
Click Apply, then click Run to launch the program. The Console view displays the program output.
